Class Future<T>

An implementation of IFuture<T> that can be used internally by methods that return futures.

Inheritance
System.Object
Future<T>
Implements
IFuture<T>
Inherited Members

System.Object.ToString()
Namespace: UnityToolBox.Pattern
Assembly: Assembly-CSharp.dll
Syntax
public sealed class Future<T> : IFuture<T>
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

The type of object being retrieved.
Remarks

Methods should always return the IFuture<T> interface when calling code requests a future. This class is intended to be constructed internally in the method to provide a simple implementation of the interface. By returning the interface instead of the class it ensures the implementation can change later on if requirements change, without affecting the calling code.

Methods

| Improve this Doc View Source

Assign(T)

Allows manually assigning a value to a future, as long as it is still in the pending state.

Declaration
public void Assign(T value)
Parameters
Type Name Description
T value

The value to assign the future.
Remarks

There are times where you may not need to do background processing for a value. For example, you may have a cache of values and can just hand one out. In those cases you still want to return a future for the method signature, but can just call this method to fill in the future.

| Improve this Doc View Source

Fail(Exception)

Allows manually failing a future, as long as it is still in the pending state.

Declaration
public void Fail(Exception error)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Exception error

The exception to use to fail the future.
Remarks

As with the Assign method, there are times where you may know a future value is a failure without doing any background work. In those cases you can simply fail the future manually and return it.

Process(Func<T>)

Begins running a given function on a background thread to resolve the future's value, as long as it is still in the Pending state.
